title: Find the common factor
text: Is there a greatest common factor of all the terms in the expression $$27x y^3+48x y$$?
speech: Is there a greatest common factor of all the terms in the expression  27 x y cubed, plus 48 x y ?

title: Factor out the greatest common term
Factoring Completely
text: There is no way to further factor $$3x y$$. Are there any ways to factor $$9y^2+16$$?
speech: There is no way to further factor  3 x y, . Are there any ways to factor  9 y squared plus 16 ?
pacedSpeech: There is no way to further factor   3 x y,
. Are there any ways to factor   9 y squared plus 16

title: Finished Factoring
text: We can rewrite $$9y^2+16$$ as $${\left(3y\right)}^2+4^2$$. Note that sum of squares is prime so it is not factorable. Therefore, we can not further factor $$9y^2+16$$.
speech: We can rewrite  9 y squared, plus, 16  as , parentheses 3 y  squared plus, 4 squared . Note that sum of squares is prime so it is not factorable. Therefore, we can not further factor  9 y squared plus 16 .

. Note that sum of squares is prime so it is not factorable. Therefore, we can not further factor   9 y squared plus 16

title: Put together all factors
text: Since we can not further factor $$9y^2+16$$ and $$3x y$$, $$27x y^3+48x y$$ can factor completely into $$3x y \left(9y^2+16\right)$$
speech: Since we can not further factor  9 y squared, plus 16  and  3 x y, , , 27 x y cubed plus 48 x y,  can factor completely into  3 x y parentheses, 9 y squared, plus 16
